message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.NI, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses three problems related to information theory and graph theory: index coding, locally recoverable distributed storage, and guessing games on graphs. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is a likely sub-category. The paper also uses graph theory concepts such as confusion graphs, fractional chromatic number, and independence number, which suggests that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) are also likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the optimal rate region and capacity region of these problems, which may fall under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
